Articles.Content:
Is there a mod that allows me to scale controls with respect to velocity? With FAR, most of my more agile planes correctly explode due to aerodynamic stresses if I turn at low speeds due to high control authority. On the other hand this level of control authority is required to perform maneuvers at higher speeds. I'd need to dynamically lower the control input as speed decreases.

Thanks

Agreed we need something like that! I don't believe there is one.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68470-Tweakable-control-surfaces-during-flight](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68470-Tweakable-control-surfaces-during-flight)
FAR itself has it. It's called DCA.

> 
> FAR itself has it. It's called DCA.

As FAR as I know DCA does the opposite of what I need, i.e. lowers the sensitivity with increasing velocity which is absolutely useless (to me at least). Is there a trick to reverse the scaling?
You know about pressing CapsLock to switch to fine-tune controls right? The indications in the bottom left will switch from orange to blue.

> 
> You know about pressing CapsLock to switch to fine-tune controls right? The indications in the bottom left will switch from orange to blue.

That doesn't help in the slightest. It just makes reaching full control surface angle take a bit longer. I'd need to limit the maximum to a set percentage depending on speed - exactly like the DCA mentioned above but with reverse scaling.
Wow, I totally misread the OP. Apologies. I am not aware of any 'reverse DCA' as it were.
